subject: Cybersecurity
title: OAuth: Delegated Authorization Without Sharing Passwords
description: Learn OAuth: Delegated Authorization Without Sharing Passwords in one minute.

hook.text: You give a fitness app access to your Google Calendar without sharing your Google password. How does that work?

buildup.text: OAuth issues tokens that grant specific, limited access. The app gets a token to read your calendar â€“ not your.

discovery.text: OAuth separates authentication (who you are) from authorization (what you can do). Tokens can be scoped and revoked.

twist.text: Malicious OAuth apps have tricked users into granting broad permissions. One click on 'Allow' and the app has access.

climax.text: OAuth is powerful but dangerous when users don't read permission scopes. 'Allow' is the most dangerous button on.

punchline.text: Read the permissions before you click 'Allow.' Nobody does.

quiz.question: How does OAuth protect user credentials?
options: It issues scoped tokens instead of sharing the actual password
